newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelans march against Caldera gov't in Caracas.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelans march against Caldera gov't in Caracas.

text.p: About 3,000 people from various unions and organizations, marched Tuesday in the Venezuelan capital to protest deteriorating living standards under President Rafael Caldera's government.
The march, organized by striking university professors, was largely peaceful, although police fired tear gas and plastic bullets to disperse some rock- and bottle-throwing protesters.

Professors and students from 17 public universities nationwide -- on strike for six weeks over pay -- led the march which also included about 500 employees of airline Viasa which the government announced would be liquidated last week.
Protesters carried banners maligning Caldera and Planning Minister Teodoro Petkoff. A large skeleton which represented the International Monetary Fund accompanied the march.

President Rafael Caldera's government has faced a growing number of strikes and protests since the beginning of the year over high inflation rates which have whittled real wages down to 30 percent of 1980 levels.
